page.title: 03FOSSE WOOD
page.content: Twenty-five years ago this area of woodland was swamp and marshland. The present owner began by digging three ponds,and ditches for drainage.A variety of deciduous trees were planted.Each year after the clearance of scrub,the remaining area is replanted with deciduous and conifer trees. Ferns and water-lilies adorn the pond areas,and the native wild iris proliferates,orchids can also be found.This in turn has encouraged the return of insect and animal life.A variety of birds are also attracted to this woodland sanctuary,and ducks to the pond area. From an economic point of view,the conifers provide all the fencing stakes necessary for the two farms which own this wood.
